alert.note: Alert for Assumption; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern St. John The Baptist, southeastern St. James, southern St. Charles, northeastern Lafourche and eastern Assumption Parishes through 545 PM CDT... At 522 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Chackbay to 9 miles southeast of Bayou Gauche. Movement was west at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. There is some rotation in the storms so a very brief, weak tornado or landspout is possible. Be aware that a warning may need to be issued. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Thibodaux, Paradis, Des Allemands, South Vacherie, Chackbay, Bayou Gauche, North Vacherie, Boutte, Raceland, Mathews and Luling. This includes Interstate 310 near mile marker 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; St. Charles; St. James; St. John The Baptist; Upper Lafourche
